questions.question: What is the formula for calculating the probability of having exactly 'n' customers in an M/G/c/N queueing system?

explanations.a: Incorrect. The Poisson distribution is not used for this calculation in an M/G/c/N queueing system.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The Erlang distribution is not used for this calculation in an M/G/c/N queueing system.
explanations.c: Correct. The Pollaczek-Khinchine formula calculates the probability of having 'n' customers in an M/G/c/N queueing system.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The steady-state probability equation is not used for this calculation in an M/G/c/N queueing system.

questions.question: In an M/G/c/N queueing system, how can the Erlang distribution be leveraged to optimize system performance?

answers.a: By adjusting the shape parameter to minimize service variability
answers.b: By increasing the scale parameter to improve server utilization
answers.c: By utilizing Erlang B formula to optimize server staffing levels
answers.d: By applying Little's Law to reduce waiting times

explanations.a: Correct. Adjusting the shape parameter of the Erlang distribution can help minimize service variability, improving system performance in an M/G/c/N queueing model.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Increasing the scale parameter is not related to leveraging the Erlang distribution in an M/G/c/N queueing system.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The Erlang B formula is not directly related to optimizing system performance in an M/G/c/N queueing system.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Little's Law is not directly related to leveraging the Erlang distribution in an M/G/c/N queueing system.

questions.question: In an M/G/c/N queueing system, how can the system effectively manage congestion during peak hours?

answers.a: Adding more servers to increase capacity
answers.b: Implementing priority queuing for certain customers
answers.c: Using predictive analytics to adjust staffing levels based on expected demand
answers.d: Utilizing preemptive queue management techniques to handle surges

explanations.a: Incorrect. Adding more servers may not be feasible during peak hours and does not address the dynamic nature of congestion.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Priority queuing may help certain customers but does not address overall congestion management.
explanations.c: Correct. Predictive analytics can forecast demand and adjust staffing to manage congestion effectively in an M/G/c/N queueing system.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Preemptive queue management techniques may be helpful, but they are not specifically tailored to managing congestion during peak hours.
